title: Obama And Modi Aim To Strengthen U.S.-India Ties
teaser: India political scholar Sumit Ganguly discusses the negotiations and the political climate shaped by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
contentencoded:
On a three-day visit to India, President Obama became the first American president to serve as guest of honor for India’s Republic Day, a major holiday marking when the countryâ€™s postpartition democratic Constitution came into force in 1950.

Meeting with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, both claimed breakthroughs on nuclear, environmental and defense negotiations.

Here & Now’s Lisa Mullins spoke with India political scholar Sumit Ganguly for a look at those negotiations and the political climate shaped by Modi.

Guest

  • Sumit Ganguly, professor of political science at Indiana University in Bloomington, and director of the university’s Center on American and Global Security.
